intro: Pfaffia gnaphalioides var. floccosa, commonly known as the Brazilian ginseng or *Pará ginseng*, is a perennial herb native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous communities for its purported health benefits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ecological and potential pharmacological significance, it is often studied for conservation and sustainable use.
